alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 8:08PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Smith, southern Franklin and southwestern Webster Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 807 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Franklin, or 29 miles northeast of Phillipsburg, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Riverton, Inavale, Red Cloud and Cowles. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for north central Kansas...and south central Nebraska.
